title: The One with the Sonogram at the End

utterances.transcript: What you guys don't understand is, for us, kissing is as important as any part of it.
Yeah, right!.......Y'serious?
Oh, yeah!
Everything you need to know is in that first kiss.
Absolutely.
Yeah, I think for us, kissing is pretty much like an opening act, y'know? I mean it's like the stand-up comedian you have to sit through before Pink Floyd comes out.
Yeah, and-and it's not that we don't like the comedian, it's that-that... that's not why we bought the ticket.

The problem is, though, after the concert's over, no matter how great the show was, you girls are always looking for the comedian again, y'know? I mean, we're in the car, we're fighting traffic... basically just trying to stay awake.
Yeah, well, word of advice: Bring back the comedian. Otherwise next time you're gonna find yourself sitting at home, listening to that album alone.
....Are we still talking about sex?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (pause)....Are we still talking about sex?

plots: Ross mentions that men do not dislike the comedian - it is just not why they bought the ticket .

Continuing the metaphorical theme , Rachel makes the point that , if men do n't bring the comedian back after the show , men will be sitting at home next time , listening to the Pink Floyd album alone .
Joey is completely stumped at this point , unsure whether Ross , Chandler , Rachel and Joey are still talking about sex .
Rachel , Monica , Joey , Chandler , and Ross discuss kissing before sex .

utterances.transcript: No, it's good, it is good, it's just that- mm- doesn't she seem a little angry?
Well, she has issues.
Does she.
He's out banging other women over the head with a club, while she sits at home trying to get the mastodon smell out of the carpet!
Marsha, these are cave people. Okay? They have issues like 'Gee, that glacier's getting kinda close.' See?
Speaking of issues, isn't that your ex-wife?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Carol, Ross's ex-wife, has entered behind them and is standing outstide the exhibit.)

utterances.transcript: No. No.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (trying to ignore her) No. No.

utterances.transcript: Yes, it is. Carol! Hi!
Okay, okay, yes, it is. How about I'll, uh, catch up with you in the Ice Age.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, okay, yes, it is. (waves) How about I'll, uh, catch up with you in the Ice Age.
(Marsha extis and Ross waves Carol into the exhibit.)

utterances.transcript: Hi.
So.
You look great. I, uh... I hate that.
Sorry. You look good too.
Ah, well, in here, anyone who... stands erect... So what's new? Still, uh...
A lesbian?
Well... you never know. How's, um.. how's the family?
Marty's still totally paranoid. Oh, and, uh-
Why- why are you here, Carol?
I'm pregnant.
Pregnant?!

plots: Ross finds out his ex-wife ( Carol ) , who is now a lesbian , is pregnant .
At the Museum of Prehistoric History , Ross and a colleague set up a display of cave people .
Carol sees Ross at the museum and tells Ross that Carol is pregnant .
Ross ' homosexual ex-wife Carol arrives , and Carol makes it clear to Ross that Carol is still a lesbian .
Carol tells Ross that Carol is pregnant .
It is a little uncomfortable between them , so Carol announces that she is pregnant with his child .

utterances.transcript: Oh, I think this is the episode of Three's Company where there's some kind of misunderstanding.
...Then I've already seen this one!
utterances.transcript_with_note: ...Then I've already seen this one! (Turns off the TV.)

utterances.transcript: Are you through with that?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (taking a drink from Joey) Are you through with that?

utterances.transcript: Yeah, sorry, the swallowing slowed me down.
Whose little ball of paper is this?!
Oh, uh, that would be mine. See, I wrote a note to myself, and then I realised I didn't need it, so I balled it up and... ...now I wish I was dead.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, uh, that would be mine. See, I wrote a note to myself, and then I realised I didn't need it, so I balled it up and... (sees that Monica is glaring at him) ...now I wish I was dead.
(Monica starts to fluff a pillow.)

utterances.transcript: She's already fluffed that pillow... Monica, you know, you've already fluffed that- -but, it's fine!
utterances.transcript_with_note: She's already fluffed that pillow... Monica, you know, you've already fluffed that- (Monica glares at her.) -but, it's fine!

utterances.transcript: Look , I'm sorry, guys, I just don't wanna give them any more ammunition than they already have.
Yes, and we all know how cruel a parent can be about the flatness of a child's pillow.
Monica- Hi! Um, Monica, you're scaring me. I mean, you're like, you're like all chaotic and twirly. And not-not in a good way.
Yeah, calm down. You don't see Ross getting all chaotic and twirly every time they come.
That's because as far as my parents are concerned, Ross can do no wrong. Y'see, he's the Prince. Apparently they had some big ceremony before I was born.
Ew, ew, ew, ew ew ew ew ew!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (looking out the window) Ew, ew, ew, ew ew ew ew ew!

utterances.transcript: What?
Ugly Naked Guy got a Thighmaster!
Eeaagh!

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Rachel enters from her room.)

utterances.transcript: Has anybody seen my engagement ring?
Yeah, it's beautiful.
Oh God, oh God, oh God oh God oh God oh God....
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh God, oh God, oh God oh God oh God oh God.... (Starts to look under the couch cushions.)

utterances.transcript: No, look, don't touch that!

Oh, like I wasn't dreading tomorrow enough, having to give it back to him... 'Hi Barry! Remember me? I'm the girl in the veil who stomped on your heart in front of your entire family!' Oh God and now I'm gonna have to return the ring, without the ring, which makes it so much harder...
Easy Rach, we'll find it. Won't we!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Easy Rach, we'll find it. (To all) Won't we!

utterances.transcript: Oh! Yeah!
Alright, when'd'ya have it on last?
Doy! Probably right before she lost it!
You don't get a lot of 'doy' these days...
I know I had it this morning, and I know I had it when I was in the kitchen with...
...Dinah?
Ohhhhh, don't be mad...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (looks at the lasagne and realizes something) Ohhhhh, don't be mad...

utterances.transcript: You didn't.
Oh, I am sorry...
I gave you one job!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I gave you one job! (Starts to examin the lasagne through the bottom of the glass pan.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, but look how straight those noodles are!
Now, Monica, you know that's not how you look for an engagement ring in a lasagne...
I just... can't do it.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (puts down the lasagne) I just... can't do it.

utterances.transcript: Boys? We're going in.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Chandler, Joey, and Phoebe start to pick through the lasagne as there's a knock on the door which Monica answers.)
(standing outside the door).....Hi.

utterances.transcript: Wow. That is not a happy hi.
Carol's pregnant.
Ooh! I found it!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (while everyone else is stunned) Ooh! I found it!

utterances.transcript: Yeah. Do that for another two hours, you might be where I am right about now.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah. Do that for another two hours, you might be where I am right about now. (He enters.)

utterances.transcript: Kinda puts that whole pillow thing in perspective, huh, Mon?
Well now, how-how do you fit into this whole thing?
Well, Carol says she and Susan want me to be involved, but if I'm not comfortable with it, I don't have to be involved.. basically it's entirely up to me.
She is so great! I miss her.
What does she mean by 'involved'?
I mean presumably, the biggest part of your job is done.
Anyway, they want me to go down to this- sonogram thing with them tomorrow.
So what are you gonna do?
I have no idea. No matter what I do, though, I'm still gonna be a father.

utterances.transcript: .....Well, this is still ruined, right?

utterances.transcript: Oh, Martha Ludwin's daughter is gonna call you. Mmm! What's that curry taste?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, Martha Ludwin's daughter is gonna call you. (Tastes a snack) Mmm! What's that curry taste?

utterances.transcript: Curry.
Mmmm!
I- I think they're great! I, I really do.
Do you remember the Ludwins? The big one had a thing for you, didn't she?

utterances.transcript: They all had a thing for him.
Aw, Mom...
I'm sorry, why is this girl going to call me?
Oh, she just graduated, and she wants to be something in cooking, or food, or.... I don't know. Anyway, I told her you had a restaurant-

Well, they don't have to know that...
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, they don't have to know that... (She starts to fluff the same pillow Monica fluffed multiple times earlier.)

utterances.transcript: Ross, could you come and help me with the spaghetti, please?
Yeah.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah. (They go to the kitchen.)

utterances.transcript: Oh, we're having spaghetti! That's.... easy.
I know this is going to sound unbelievably selfish, but, were you planning on bringing up the whole baby/lesbian thing? Because I think it might take some of the heat off me.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Time Lapse, everyone is now eating.]

utterances.transcript: What that Rachel did to her life.... We ran into her parents at the club, they were not playing very well.
I'm not gonna tell you what they spent on that wedding... but forty thousand dollars is a lot of money!
Well, at least she had the chance to leave a man at the altar...
What's that supposed to mean?
Nothing! It's an expression.
No it's not.

Don't listen to your mother. You're independent, and you always have been! Even when you were a kid... and you were chubby, and you had no friends, you were just fine! And you would read alone in your room, and your puzzles...

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Time Lapse.]

utterances.transcript: Look, there are people like Ross who need to shoot for the stars, with his museum, and his papers getting published. Other people are satisfied with staying where they are- I'm telling you, these are the people who never get cancer.

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Time Lapse.]

utterances.transcript: ...And I read about these women trying to have it all, and I thank God 'Our Little Harmonica' doesn't seem to have that problem.
So, Ross, what's going on with you? Any stories? No news, no little anecdotes to share with the folks?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (trying desperately to change the subject) So, Ross, what's going on with you? Any stories? (Digs her elbow into his hand.) No news, no little anecdotes to share with the folks?

utterances.transcript: Okay! Okay. Look, I, uh- I realise you guys have been wondering what exactly happened between Carol and me, and, so, well, here's the deal. Carol's a lesbian. She's living with a woman named Susan. She's pregnant with my child, and she and Susan are going to raise the baby.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (pulls his hand away) Okay! Okay. (To his parents) Look, I, uh- I realise you guys have been wondering what exactly happened between Carol and me, and, so, well, here's the deal. Carol's a lesbian. She's living with a woman named Susan. She's pregnant with my child, and she and Susan are going to raise the baby.
(Stunned silence ensues.)

utterances.transcript: And you knew about this?!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Monica) And you knew about this?!

Rachel tries to play it cool , but Rachel is actually hurt that Barry has already forgotten Rachel and moved on so quickly .
Rachel becomes angry and begins to yell at Barry because of Barry 's new romance .
Barry and Rachel discuss their failed relationship and she returns her ring .

utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, I was just wondering about the mother-to-be, but.. thanks for sharing. (To Carol) Uh, lie back..

utterances.transcript: You- uh- y'know what, I'm gonna go. I don't- I don't think I can be involved in this particular thing right now.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (He turns to go, but the sound of the sonogram catches hes ear. He returns and stares at it.)

utterances.transcript: Oh my God.
Look at that.
I know.

plots: Ross is about to leave , but then Ross sees the sonogram on the monitor , so Ross stays to watch .
Ross argues With Carol and Susan over the last name of their child .
Susan tried to explain that this is her baby too .

utterances.transcript: Well? Isn't that amazing?
What are we supposed to be seeing here?
I dunno, but.. I think it's about to attack the Enterprise.
You know, if you tilt your head to the left, and relax your eyes, it kinda looks like an old potato.
Then don't do that, alright?
Okay!
Monica. Whaddya think?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (walks over to where Monica is standing)Monica. Whaddya think?

utterances.transcript: Mm-hmm.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (welling up) Mm-hmm.

utterances.transcript: Wh- are you welling up?
No.
You are, you're welling up.
Am not!
You're gonna be an aunt.
Oh shut up!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (pushes him and starts to cry) Oh shut up!

utterances.transcript: Hi, Mindy. Hi, it-it's Rachel. Yeah, I'm fine. I-I saw Barry today. Oh, yeah, yeah he-he told me. No, no, it's okay. I hope you two are very happy, I really do. Oh, oh, and Mind, y'know, if-if everything works out, and you guys end up getting married and having kids- and everything- I just hope they have his old hairline and your old nose. Okay, I know it was a cheap shot, but I feel so much better now.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (on phone) Hi, Mindy. Hi, it-it's Rachel. Yeah, I'm fine. I-I saw Barry today. Oh, yeah, yeah he-he told me. No, no, it's okay. I hope you two are very happy, I really do. Oh, oh, and Mind, y'know, if-if everything works out, and you guys end up getting married and having kids- and everything- I just hope they have his old hairline and your old nose. (Slams the phone down.) (To everyone) Okay, I know it was a cheap shot, but I feel so much better now.

Ross is showing everyone his sonogram , they ca n't really tell what it is but Monica is touched and begins to well up . Rachel puts Mindy down over the phone .
